snippet: Book publishers are frustrated with Amazon’s strategy of pricing e-books low.

snippet: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar news. Thursday's selections include speculation that Apple's mobile devices may be trying to distance themselves from Google's map service and an e...
abstract: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar news. Thursday's selections include speculation that Apple's mobile devices may be trying to distance themselves from Google's map service and an extensive statistical analysis of personal e-mail, phone calls and keystrokes.

headline.main: Today's Scuttlebot: A Very Examined Life, and Cable TV as an App

snippet: The Justice Department is threatening to sue Apple and five big publishers over a pricing model for electronic books that it says constitutes collusion and violates antitrust laws.

snippet: Songkick, an online service that alerts fans about local concerts by their favorite artists, has received a $10 million investment from Sequoia Capital. Ian Hogarth, Songkick's chief executive, spoke with Media Decoder on Thursday about the invest...
